data.title: United States Lifesaving Association
data.meta_description: United States Lifesaving Association | 666 followers on LinkedIn. America's nonprofit association of beach lifeguards and open water resuers | The United States Lifesaving Association is America's nonprofit, professional association of beach lifeguards and open water rescuers. The USLA works to reduce the incidence of death and injury in the aquatic environment through public education, national lifeguard standards, training programs, promotion of high levels of lifeguard readiness, and other means.
data.text:
Today was the last day of the Jersey Mike's Subs USLA National Lifeguard Championships in South Padre Island, TX. Competitors from around the nation worked hard all week, testing their skills in events in the ocean and on the sand designed to promote camaraderie among competitors, coaches, and families in attendance. Thank you to all those who participated in the week’s events for your hard work and determination, and congratulations to the 2024 National Champions Sussex County, (DE). Look forward to our official recap post with results coming soon. All Championship information, including results, will be posted at USLA.org/nationals. Photography by: Leal Media #usla #lifeguardsforlife

Did you know that despite being the first line of defense in life-threatening ocean rescues, most open-water lifeguards in the U.S. are not recognized as first responders? It’s time to change that. In partnership with the USLA for the “LIFEGUARDS FIRST” campaign, FOX’s new drama series #RescueHISurf highlights the heroic actions of lifeguards who patrol and protect life at sea. Together, we are supporting the “LIFEGUARDS FIRST” campaign. This important letter-writing initiative aims to grant open-water lifeguards the benefits and recognition of Emergency First Responders. Take a stand today! Visit RHSFirstResponders.com and let your voice be heard. Your support can ensure that lifeguards receive the same recognition and benefits as their counterparts in police, fire, and EMS services. Share this message and spread the word. Every letter counts in our mission to secure the benefits and recognition that lifeguards deserve. And once the hard work is done, relax and tune into the premiere of #RescueHISurf on September 22 on @foxtv to see the thrilling lives of lifeguards portrayed like never before! #LifeguardsFirst #SupportHCR41 #USLA

Competitors brought their all on day two of the Jersey Mike's USLA National Lifeguard Championships in South Padre Island, TX. There were many heats, but we also had the finals of the Men’s and Women’s Run-Swim-Run and Paddle Board relay. Congratulations to the following athletes on becoming the 2024 National Champions after a long day of racing: Run-Swim-Run Men’s: Alexander Cole Women’s: Claire Kelly Paddle Board Relay: Men’s: Brian Murphy, Lukas Pohlman, Patrick Jacobson Women’s: Casey Francis, Gwen Bencie, Shannon Snell Reminder: to livestream the event, download the Rio Sports Live Network (RSLN) app or check out riosportslive.com. Trouble with the direct link? We’ve got you covered at USLA.org/nationals. Good luck to all of the competitors in the coming two days! Photography: Gary Quesenberry #usla #lifeguardsforlife #uslanationals2024

We’re here in South Padre Island, TX, for the Jersey Mike's USLA National Lifeguard Championships. Congratulations to all of the hardworking Junior and U19 athletes who competed today! For the rest of the week, competitors will be testing their surf lifesaving skills and speed against fellow lifesavers from around the country. To livestream the event, download the Rio Sports Live Network (RSLN) app or check out riosportslive.com. Good luck to all of the competitors as they compete for medals, bragging rights and a chance for their team to be named the best in the nation! All Championship information, including results, will be posted at USLA.org/nationals. Photographer: Leal Media #USLA #LifeguardsForLife #USlifesavingSport #USLA #LifeguardsForLife #USlifesavingSport

LAST CHANCE FOR NOMINATIONS: The USLA Ben Carlson Lifeguard of the Year Award nomination period closes on August 10, 2024. The deadline is fast approaching! If you know a lifeguard who embodies the true spirit of guardianship over our aquatic environments, learn more and nominate them now at https://lnkd.in/e4w44qAN! This prestigious award honors lifeguards who demonstrate outstanding dedication, skill, and a profound love for open waters. #usla #lifeguardsforlife

Are you joining us to compete alongside over 1,000 of your fellow USLA members in intense displays of lifesaving sport in the ocean and on the sand? The Jersey Mike’s USLA National Lifeguard and Junior Lifeguard Championships kicks off next Tuesday, August 6th. The deadline to register for all competitor events is Sunday August 4, 11:59 PM EDT. If you register after the cutoff, you can still participate and will have to show up at the line when the event is called and confirm with the course official that you want to participate. Visit USLAnationals.org for more information, including registration FAQs. #usla #lifeguardsforlife

Did you know that July 31st is International Lifeguard Appreciation Day? The USLA sends a sincere THANK YOU to all lifeguards working around the world to reduce the incidence of death and injury in the aquatic environment. Lifeguards do much more than perform rescues. They educate the public, perform preventative actions, adhere to national standards, train vigorously to maintain a high level of readiness, and more. Wherever a lifeguard may be working, the environment is a safer place because of their presence. Be sure to thank your local lifeguard(s) today, and remember – always swim near a lifeguard! Photography: California State Lifeguards Volusia Surf Lifesaving Association John Glenn Orange Beach Surf Rescue Kauai Ocean Safety Bureau EBRPD Lifeguard Service

Join us in Waikīkī Beach, Hawaii, for the Fall 2024 Board of Directors Meeting and Educational Conference as we celebrate USLA’s 60th anniversary! This event, graciously hosted by the Pacific Islands Region, offers incredible educational opportunities for all attendees, including: –Personal Watercraft Rescue Training: Advance your rescue skills under the leadership of top Hawai’i rescue craft operators, led by Instructor Kalani Vierra. –Beach Guardian Workshop: Discover a program that teaches community members lifesaving skills for emergencies when lifeguards or first responders are not available, aiming to inspire similar programs in other communities. This event is packed with more educational opportunities to come, so stay tuned for further announcements. Celebrate and learn with us, enhancing your skills and knowledge while contributing to your community. Employers, support your teams by investing in this invaluable learning experience. Learn more and register now at USLA.org/events – don’t miss this meeting! #usla #lifeguardsforlife
